TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpRequestExecutor extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Sends HTTP requests and receives the responses.

remarks.para: Sends HTTP requests and receives the responses. Takes care of request preprocessing and response postprocessing by the respective interceptors.

The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool CanResponseHaveBody (Org.Apache.Http.IHttpRequest request, Org.Apache.Http.IHttpResponse response);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanResponseHaveBody(class Org.Apache.Http.IHttpRequest request, class Org.Apache.Http.IHttpResponse response) cil managed

Docs.param: the request, to obtain the executed method
the response, to obtain the status code
Docs.summary: Decide whether a response comes with an entity.

remarks.para:
Decide whether a response comes with an entity. The implementation in this class is based on RFC 2616. Unknown methods and response codes are supposed to indicate responses with an entity.
Derived executors can override this method to handle methods and response codes not specified in RFC 2616.

Docs.param: the request for which to obtain the response
the connection over which the request was sent
the context for receiving the response
Docs.summary: Wait for and receive a response.

remarks.para: Wait for and receive a response. This method will automatically ignore intermediate responses with status code 1xx.

Docs.exception: in case of a protocol or processing problem
in case of an I/O problem

Docs.param: the connection over which to send the request, already established
the context for sending the request
Docs.summary: Send a request over a connection.

remarks.para: Send a request over a connection. This method also handles the expect-continue handshake if necessary. If it does not have to handle an expect-continue handshake, it will not use the connection for reading or anything else that depends on data coming in over the connection.

Docs.exception: in case of a protocol or processing problem
in case of an I/O problem

Docs.param: the context for post-processing the response

remarks.para: Finish a response. This includes post-processing of the response object. It does not read the response entity, if any. It does not allow for immediate re-use of the connection over which the response is coming in.

Docs.exception: in case of a protocol or processing problem
in case of an I/O problem

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
